text.p: The Carbide/Graphite Group Inc said Monday it planned to invest $22 million to increase production at a needle coke facility in located in Seadrift, Texas.
The company said in a statement it will fund the expansion at Seadrift Coke LP through internal cash flow and available credit facilities.
"(The expansion) is expected to significantly improve the earnings potential of (the company)," it said.
It said it expected to compete the project in a year, increasing capacity by more than 30 percent from 130,000 tons to more than 170,000 tons.
"Installation of equipment for the project is planned for the third quarter of (the company's) fiscal 1998 and will require the Seadrift plant to be idle for approximately two weeks," it said.
The Carbide/Graphite Group makes industrial graphite and calcium carbide products.
